pros: This place challenges me in so many aspects. I have learned more on the job here in the last four years than I did in the four years I was in college. I am on the administration side and have  learned to embrace change. This is the most beautiful healthcare facility I have ever seen. I love how passionate the people are that work here and how they encourage others to be the best version of themselves.
cons: If you don't like change, this place might not be for you.

pros: Outpatient Care, Outpatient Radiology, and Emergency Department care was top notch and exemplary.  There are very good people here, but the poor leadership overshadowed the entire operation.
cons:
Poor operational and executive management. Terrible communication and rapport with medical staff, hospital employees, and news reps. New leadership will have a large mess to clean up and hopefully the institution can rise from the ashes left by the former ceO and his cronies.
Whatever positive clinical experience the patient(s) received would soon be  forgotten, and even negated,  when dealing with billing and hospital administration. CLEAN THIS UP FIRST.

pros: The people I work with are very professional and the environment is a lot of fun. We work hard but the teamwork is the best I've ever been experienced. Department managers strive to give employees what they need in order to be successful.
cons: The company has not given raises despite exceptional reviews from supervisor. Cafateria is not always open in order for employees to buy their breakfast or lunch.

pros: I loved helping patients understand their insurance, and admitting patients to lrmc.  Loved the fast pace environment.
cons: TERRIBLE DIRECTOR!  (loved my direct supervisor) however the new ones that came in took over the department and then it was horrible due to back stabbing and favortism, the new supervisor was very immature and not suited to be a supervisor!

pros: Able to set own hours as long as the work was completed for the day.
cons: No growth, no raise after 18 months, except for upper management.

review_title: Has potential to be a great hospital
pros: The people were great to work with, beautiful facilities!!
cons: Upper management was terrible in the short time I worked there the CFO had been replaced 3 times

pros: Beautiful facility. Everything is clean and new.
cons: High employee turnover and still trying to iron out our processes.

review_title: Worst upper non-clinical management team I've ever encountered. Extremely "cliquish" and judgmental.
pros: Pay was decent and the facility was beautiful. The patients were great too. Oh, the food wasn't bad and they offered free sodas to employees.
cons: Nun Clinical Management Directors and above.
